info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 5:17PM EDT until July 12 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Litchfield County in northern Connecticut... Southern Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... Northeastern Dutchess County in east central New York... South central Columbia County in east central New York... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 517 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Becket to near Pine Plains, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Lee, Sheffield, Millerton, Salisbury, Washington, Tyringham, Whitehouse Crossing, Hartsville, Spencer Corners, Newsboy Statue, Mount Riga, Alander, State Line, Taconic, Pulvers Corners, Joyceville, Lakeville, Barton Corners and Boston Corner. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
